text.section: In this section, "Central Repository" means the Criminal Justice Information System Central Repository of the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services.

The County Administrator in Washington County may request with reference to a prospective employee of Washington County:
a State and national criminal history records check from the Central Repository; or
a background investigation from an independent private investigation agency.

section.section:
As part of the application for a criminal history records check, the County Administrator of Washington County shall submit to the Central Repository:
two complete sets of the prospective employee's legible fingerprints taken on forms approved by the Director of the Central Repository and the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation;
the fee authorized under § 10-221(b)(7) of this subtitle for access to Maryland criminal history records; and
the mandatory processing fee required by the Federal Bureau of Investigation for a national criminal history records check.

In accordance with §§ 10-201 through 10-234 of this subtitle, the Central Repository shall forward to the prospective employee and the County Administrator of Washington County the prospective employee's criminal history record information.

Information obtained from the Central Repository under this section:
is confidential and may not be redisseminated; and
may be used only for the employment purpose authorized by this section.
The subject of a criminal history records check under this section may contest the contents of the printed statement issued by the Central Repository as provided in § 10-223 of this subtitle.

text.section: The County Administrator of Washington County shall pay to the independent private investigation agency the fee that is imposed for each request made under subsection (b) of this section.
The County Commissioners of Washington County may adopt regulations, guidelines, and policies to carry out this section.
